Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BE MISLEAD!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie B Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very run down! I was tricked by an Expedia agent into booking this room. Gave me the Travelodge number when I thought it was the Howard Johnson! I booked a King Jacuzzi suite only to find a Queen sized bed... if you're goint to give me a Qeen the SAY IT'S A QUEEN! I booked the room and was not told that the tax would be 13%. The deal went from $79 to $111. THEY DO NOT TELL YOU ABOUT THE TAXES! FOR THAT MUCH MONEY I COULD HAVE GONE TO A MORE REPUTABLE CHAIN DOWN THE STREET! THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE WHEN I CALLED FOR AN EXPLANATION! SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE AND JUST GO DOWN THE STREET TO A BETTER HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ogrif
Reviews.Content: We booked non-smoking room with kitchenette but when we arrived staff only offered us a smoking room and we were told that the hotel is full - really, they did not even bother to tell us that the room was the smoking one: we found out ourselves when entered by the smell....Only after half an hour negotiations we were able to secure a non-smoking room but without kitchenette and still for the same price. The room was so so... Hotel don't really bother to maintain rooms because of the good location and constant demand. Also free breakfast was "horrible experience" when they serve all hotel guests in the very very very small room - there is no place to sit, to stand and you wait for your turn to get to very poor selection of foods.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Martnico
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 28th March to 31st March 2012, check in was easy and we were off to our room. We had 2 double beds in one room which was clean with a tv and coffee machine. We didn't have a car so the free bus service to some of the parks was good and you have several restaurants near by. We only used this for 2 days as a base as we had to change our filights and couldn't change our origianl accomodation and only paid paid £98 for 3 nights for 2 adults and 2 children. Was ideal for a short stop but wouldn't want to stay for 2 weeks. Overall a clean place to stay for a short stay, free breakfast was a basic continental style which we did for the first morning but went else where for the next 2 mornings. Room was cleaned every day while we were there and beds made, would go back for a 1 or 2 day stop over but any longer I would look for somewhere more up market. Nothing at all to compalin about.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, not expensive”
Reviews.Author: Audre M
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight with a reservation. For some reason, we got a suite with spa in the room. May be they were out of room, and we got upgraded. It was busy in town. Stayed for 2 nights, and used the spa many times. It was a great stay with the price I paid, and the room is clean. Next time I will reserve the suite with spa.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: GREASEPIT
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night and that was enough. The carpet in the room was tore up. The bathroom had holes in wall. The couch had several stains on it on which I didn't even consider sitting on. The whole place was dated, shabby and filthy.I don't get all the good reviews. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Still the same great little place!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaKiraHannah
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time here for sure we've been a couple of other times but it had been a while since the last visit. I was pleasantly surprised to find the same manager still in charge of the hotel. We arrived late at night after having issues with another reservation and were thrilled to have been in the teddy bear room. My toddler thought this was great. The room had obviously been painted since we were last there. We had a fridge and a microwave which were both wonderful. The beds were comfortable and clean, same as the washroom and all the other room amenities. We had a quick swim in a pleasant pool the next morning. I think one of the things I love most about this place is the fact that they treat you like you are family coming home for a visit. The girl at the front desk went out of her way to find me some extra milk for the baby so that I wouldn't have to drag her in and out of the local walgreens late at night. It's the little extra's that always make a hotel for me. Honestly for this price range this hotel would be my absolute first pick on the 192 strip. We'll always be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel while visiting Disney. For a great price, it's a great location, near Disney, with many restaurants and other attractions along the route. The motel was clean, quiet, the staff was very friendly and welcoming to us, the spacious room had two comfortable beds with an additional sofa, large coffee table and TV for relaxing in the room. There was also a microwave, mini Refrigerator and a coffee maker. As Florida residents, living along the coast, we bought Disney passes and plan to return there often, making this Travel Lodge our weekend home again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Florida”
Reviews.Author: Vickie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the 1st time in early Jan 2012. We only planned on staying here the first night & was going to find something "better" the next. We ended up remaining here for our entire trip. We also stayed here the next time we came down a couple of weeks later. Price was great, rooms were very clean and the beds were excellent. Hotel staff was very helpful about anything we needed. Also, it is in a great location. I would definitely recommend this place to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room for the Money”
Reviews.Author: BobsBestFriend
Reviews.Content: It's an old motel but the rooms are very large with 2 double beds AND a sofa. The rooms also have refrigerators and microwaves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: BestDancer2
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three week stay at the Travelodge Suites East Gate Orange. The rooms are large consisting of two double beds, a sleeper sofa, mico, fridge, table and chairs. The rooms are clean and well maintained by the staff. The hot tub was a welcome spot after a long day at Disney. The staff are friendly and welcoming. There are many nearby restaurants to meet anyone's needs. The drive to the Disney parks is a straight shot up 192 from the hotel. We never took more that 10 minutes to get there. There is a shuttle but we did not use it. Also the local bus stops in front and will take you to the Disney ticket and transportation center. This is a family motel and priced well. The continental breakfast consisted of cereals, toast, muffins, fresh fruit, juice, coffee and tea. It was plenty to get your day started. You can eat in the breakfast room or bring it back to your room. The room also had a coffee maker. The free wifi worked well in our room and was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: Nepean03
Reviews.Content: The friendly, caring staff of this location are what makes it a place that I return to time after time. The rooms/suites are large enough that you don't feel in each others way. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are kept clean by a hard working staff. The hot tub and pool area need refurbishment but are well maintained and clean. I feel very safe at this location. It is only minutes to DisneyWorld and there are many restaurants nearby including several within walking distance. The manager and staff really care about this property and work hard to make it as good as it can be. Whenever you meet a staff member they smile, say hello and ask how your vacation is. We were there for 22 nights and did not want to leave. The continental breakfast includes fresh fruit, cereal, muffins, toast, juice and coffee. It is sufficient to get your day started but if you want a hot breakfast there is an excellent Waffle House in the front parking lot. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “I've Stayed in better for $64 a night”
Reviews.Author: Alan R
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night last week, front desk area smelled fusty and the scruffy man with the beard should have been enough to put me off, as it was only 1 night I decided to stay. The room was dated and did not smell clean, see through towels and poor A/C will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the open minded.”
Reviews.Author: Kymmie_girl
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this location for 5 nights at the end of Oct. The staff was very friendly and informative. The rooms were a bit dated, but comfy and clean. The breakfast was your usual continental...cereal, muffins, coffee, etc. The kids loved the pool, and the spa was wonderful to relax in after a long day of exploring the parks. We would definately stay here again. It was a great deal at 149.99 for 5 nights! If you come into this experience expecting a 5 star hotel, you will be disapointed. However; if you dont mind your surroundings being a bit vintage, and are just looking for a clean, comfortable hotel to sleep at night this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay spoilt by a smoker”
Reviews.Author: royj
Reviews.Content: Arrived abit late due to airline delay and problems at car rental desk,Miss Sophie checked us in and was very pleasent and helpful and she was able to direct us to where we could buy some special Chinese tea.The room she give us was number 251 which was away from the main road and quite large,but after so long and moving about in the room we could smell stale cigarette smoke and found a burn hole in the bed cover,I cleaned the a/c filters that were filthy to see if that would help,it made the a/c better but the room still smelt,after the second night we had a word with a different woman on the desk about the smell and the cover and also the noisy bathroom fan,when we came back to get changed the fan had been seen to but nothing else,on going back out we spoke to Miss Sophie about the problems and she offered to move us to another room but as we were going a concert we had no time to move so she arranged for 2 clean bed covers and a machine to freshen up the room when we got back we called at reception and just caught someone to remove the machine,someone had dropped off some clean covers but not put them on the beds as we had left somethings on one of the beds.The machine made no difference with the smell and we took the covers off and put a clean one on one of the beds but left the other clean one folded on top of the bed and rolled the dirty ones up to be taken away,when we returned the clean folded one had been removed and a dirty one put back on the bed and other dirty one had been left in the room,I took the dirty covers back to reception.We still kept smelling the odour during our stay and also found a empty Coke bottle behind the sofa,apart from these problems we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Honeysuckle83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in at the front reception with a fairly abrupt and disinterested lady, the reception had a musty smell which we didn't take much notice of to begin with, wrong move! We opened the door to room 113 and was met by a damp/mouldy smell,we put our bags in the room and went straight out for a few hours thinking it may have been the air con. Upon our return we took of shoes off and felt wet carpet which was also filthy as both our feet were black, in addition both beds were damp, not just the top duvet but all the sheets and pillows. There was no way we could of slept in that room, so went back over to the reception to say that we couldn't stay there and the reason why, the lady again was uninterested! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: MandyT2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on April 2011 and is not bad considering the price we paid for... We were there for 9 days and I must say that the staff is very helpful, they help us to decide what to do on our fisrt day. The room was clean and they do the room every day. The only bad thing is the breakfast they include.. they have cereal (very bad quality) bread, juice, coffee. we took it only once and the following days we decided to go to WAFFLE HOUSE wich is next door. so considering that you only use the room for sleep as you spend the day in disney it is a very good option !! ohhh and they have shuttles to disney parks. Cheers :)

Reviews.Title: “I cannot say enough”
Reviews.Author: atthebeachmls
Reviews.Content: From the time I made my reservation until I checked out I had the most pleasant experience ! I decided to bring my mother on my business trip and she is a smoker, I booked a non-smoking room.. Oops ! I called the desk and asked if they had a smoking room. Not only did they have a smoking room but the desk clerk offered to send maintenance up with a key so I did not have to go right back to the desk so I could un-pack. The room was clean and spacious ! I called the next day to request no housekeeping service, when we came back for a break housekeeping noticed we were back and called just to be sure we didnt need anything ! The pool was nice and clean the jacuzzi was wonderful, my mother enjoyed the jacuzzi the most ! There is a really neat gift shop next door (big orange) and a very large flea market ! I did not partake in the breakfast but the coffee was great ! I have to be back in the orlando area for another business adventure. I will deifinately be staying at the travelodge again ! They went above and beyond and their customer service is excellent ! Far more then what I expected ! So, it is not always true you get what you pay for ! I got what I paid for and more ! kudos to the staff at the Travelodge Suites East Gate ! See you next month ! Michelle Smith

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: bambi500
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and awesome hot tub but I woke up to bed bug bites on my leg NASTY! WE STAYED IN ADJOINING ROOMS NUMBER 136 AND 138

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Will Be Back On Our Next Visit.”
Reviews.Author: wmoriartyjr
Reviews.Content: After a tiring day of traveling, my family and I were on edge. The front desk staff was wonderful. Knowing that we were tired, they made our check in quick and easy. We were able to relax by the pool, stretch out in our spacious rooms, and sleep in extreme comfort. The price was excellent, especially for the size of the room (2 double beds and a sleeper sofa) and the amenities (free Wifi, pool, hot tub, fridge, microwave, cont. breakfast, etc.) We actually liked this place so much we called our family that was also from out of town and told them to cancel their reservations elsewhere and stay at the Travelodge instead. Would fully recommend this to anyone. Only complaint would be the pool/hot tub closed a little early (10pm).

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money - $40/night”
Reviews.Author: SarahBeth81
Reviews.Content: This is the Travelodge in Kissimmee at 5399 W Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy. This is important because there is another Travelodge in this area that is gross and dirty. This isn't a nice hotel, but it's a GREAT deal for $40 a night! The room was perfectly adequent, but worn and older, and it had a microwave and fridge in the room. Everything was as clean as it could have been (I'm sure of this because I wiped everything down with wet ones and nothing was dirty). Plus, there's a swimming pool and hot tub! The front desk service wasn't great, and at one point, a fire alarm went off scaring my 4-year-old niece. The breakfast wasn't great, so we went to the Waffle House (which is in the parking lot) every morning. It's a perfect place for families spending all day at DisneyWorld to come back and crash. I read a book before going to DisneyWorld called "Disney on a Dime" and it had a lot of great tips for saving when going to WDW. One of the other great tips I got from this book was pack your own snacks when going into WDW, and eat bigger meals off site. If and when we go back I think we'll go for 5 days to WDW doing each park the first four days (spending two days at Magic Kingdom), and only get a park hopper for the last day. Another good tip - if doing WDW mutiple days in a row take one day in the middle off. It's exhausting to go all day everyday, even though it's a blast! Hope this helps :) Have an awesome WDW trip - it's something any family can afford with good planning and saving!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: missdnell
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay at the hotel next door we were only staying for 1 night and had stayed there before. Well needless to say we did not stay next door as they had no hot water and didn't know when they would. So Anyway we went to the travelodge instead. Upon entering the hotel i was greeted by the guy behind the counter and the staff just walking through. I told him about his neighbors next door he apologized for them. Then asked how he could help. I got a room he put us right infront of the pool. When we got to our room we noticed several spider webs in the corners of the room. (My husband does not do Spiders!) So he went back to the lobby and asked if they could come and take of the webs within 5 minutes someone was knocking at the door to take care of the webs and spray. The beds were comfortable the water was hot and the staff was extremly helpfull and nice. When we left I explained to the person behind the counter Ruth about the bugs she apologized and said that she would give a really good deal the next time we stayed with them. I was extremly surprised by all of the wonderful service we recieved. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad ..”
Reviews.Author: flame01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on teh night of 4th March 2011, checking out on teh morning of 5th March. On arrival in Florida I stayed at the same location for 2 nights also Value formoney ist pretty good at approx $51 inc taxes a night. I stayed in 2 different rooms on the 2 occcasions. Both rooms although slightly dated were fine. They were clean and everything worked just fine.The internet access was pretty good in both rooms even though one was near the front and one was at the back of the hotel Only issues I would have, was the quality of the Breakfast and the size of the room it was in. The room was pretty small, maybe 10 small table ( each for 2 people) and the food area was into a corner meaning people were getting in ecah others way to get food. A continental Breakfast was provided was good enough for me, but the Coffee on offfer was the wost I have ever tasted .. please Travelodge, get your coffee right ..its not rocket science would I stay again .. yes I would

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mguilford1
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 hours driving around Disney area looking for a big, quiet, clean room that had a micro/fridge and free wi-fi. At each hotel we asked to see the room first. Most were run down, to small or dirty. This one passed the inspection. Bonus was they had a outdoor heated pool, hot tub and laundry room. They had a very basic cont. breakfast that wasnt bad and everyone was very friendly. We had a roomsaver coupon $39.99 plus $1 resort fee. Be wary of this fee at other places some were $20 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, except for tobacco smell every time you open your door”
Reviews.Author: Avidvacationer6
Reviews.Content: First time to this location, probably last. One big issue was after day at Disney came back and discovered door was not locked after housekeeping cleaned up. Luckily, nothing was missing since I placed all valuables in car. I'll take my chances with the park security rather than this locationl. Safe wasn't working.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in the area”
Reviews.Author: skanoerse
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel about 10 times during the last 20 years, we have tried quite a lot of different places in the area but somehow we either live in a more expensive hotel or we get disapointed in hotels in the same pricerange. It is the best value for money that we have found. The hotel is very well located, a bit away from the main road, close to everything. It has large rooms with good beds, a bit hard perhaps but that is only my opinion. There is fridge microwave, tv etc in the room, if something happens the maintenance fixes it promptly. The staff is very nice and helpful. We do very strongly recommend this hotel to other travellers, you wont be disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: Nepean03
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this particular Travelodge Suites 8 times since 1995 when it was reasonably new. Our last stay in late 2008 we found the hotel to be going down hill. After speaking to the manager we decided to try agin. We arrived on December 28th for a two week stay. We had three rooms and all were clean and as advertised. The rooms have new box springs and pillow top mattress, some new furniture and drapes. There are more improvements coming. During our stay the pool deck was pressure washed and repainted. The maid service was excellent, in particular Pollyana who was funny, friendly and a hard worker. The breakfast is basic ceral, toast, muffins, juice, coffee and tea. The room is very small and can get very congested but you can take it back to your room. The wifi was fast and we had no problems connecting. We would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and value for price!!”
Reviews.Author: Lansteatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a large bed and jacuzzi tub in room. We had a great weekend get away! The room was very clean and in good shape. The staff was extremely coureous and polie and were very eager to help! The woman at the front desk even drew us a map for directions. The fridge and microwave was a perfect addition to the room. If I had to say something bad the only thing I could think of is that their "game room" contains 3 or 4 arcade games that are old and not one of them worked 100% correctly but being that we were on vacation we werent looking for that anyway lol. Over all it was a fantastic stay and price! We have another trip there coming up in the next few months and I cant wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Pro's & Cons with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLDIsneyFan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline, and after I read the reviews was very curious as to how bad it could be. I arrived at 1:00 pm and found the desk clerk very courteous and professional. I was expecting a resort fee - common to most resorts in the Disney area - but was surprised to hear it as "One dollar plus tax." Usually its four or five dollars. Then I was really surprised to hear that I needed to pay a $10 Room Key deposit, refundable at check out. No big deal - but just had not experienced that in the last couple of decades! I'll list the pro's first: -New carpeting and fairly new drapes and bedspreads. -Free Wi Fi in the hotel. -Spacious rooms with two beds, sofa bed, refrigerator & microwave. -The Big Orange in the parking lot. Certainly can't miss it! -Adequate breakfast (muffins, bread, cereal, oat meal packets, bananas, oranges) -Curteous and efficient staff -Decent pool area And now, the cons: -Wall paper corning off wall in several places -Mattress definitely has seen a lot of guests -Two holes in the bath tub wall where a handle of some sort used to be -TV was locked to the cabinet, and couldn't be turned for better viewing -Some of the furniture's surfaces were peeling or peeled off Overall, the hotel was clean, I slept good, and had a great shower and breakfast before heading back to Disney. I think I got a good deal, and am much happier than I'd thought I'd be.

Reviews.Title: “cut bottom of my foot on exposed carpet tack board 3am going to bathroom”
Reviews.Author: willi339
Reviews.Content: I told the cleark at check out she acted disinterested. said I should have asked for a different room. Like I was going to wake my wife up at 3am to move to a different room. There a large number of motels in the area and I always have a choice of where to stay . we stay here often, and would have appreciated some response other than go on the web to file a complaint. I am not sure weather we will be back or not.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney parks, good value”
Reviews.Author: msantana618
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 7 nights. I traveled with my husband, 5 year old son and 5 month old daughter. I booked this property because i wanted to be close to the Disney parks and did not want to spend a lot of money on a hotel, since we would be spending most of out time outside at the parks. The room was large and spacious and clean. I needed a crib for the baby and was surprised that they provided an actual crib not a pack and play like at most hotels. The free breakfast they provide is really a joke, we ended up eating breakfast at the Waffle House a few steps away from the hotel every morning. They provide free parking and free wireless internt. Althought 3G service on my cell phone was limited. Many restaurants to choose from on same street (Unos, Chili's, Macaroni Grill across the street, Red Lobster and Olive Garden are a few blocks away). Very close to Disney theme parks, it took us 10 minutes each day to get from the hotel to the park. I went into this hotel not expecting much and it worked for us. I was not expecting luxury or amenities, it was a basic stay. Room was clean and close to the parks. So if that is what you are looking for, stay here, reasonable rates and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too comfortable and very dated.”
Reviews.Author: TheKraaken
Reviews.Content: Beds were uncomfortable, room was very dated. Creepy tourist center across the parking lot. Use this hotel to counter the Disney magic and bring the family back down to earth. Very basic continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to parks”
Reviews.Author: dlann03
Reviews.Content: We spent one night before checking into Disney hotel the next morning. The checkin staff was friendly, quick and knowledgable. The room was clean and the couch area was handy since I like to read in the middle of the night and do not want to wake up everyone else. The room was quiet at night. Restaurants are very close. The parks are an easy drive. The one bad thing is there is no elevator and of course we were on the second floor. Overall, we were happy with this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndmjax78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel March 19 - 21, 2010 as a budget way to save. We are constantly going to Disney, so to save money on the hotel and be able to splurge on gifts and food, we look for a budget hotel. I was extremely worried about this hotel based on the horrid reviews. I had my arsenal of Lysol, Bleach, and Air Fresheners lined up (I even brought my own sheets). Upon arrival, we had trouble getting into our room (the key card did not work not once, twice, but three times). It was a defective door lock, beyond their control; however every time we went to the front desk to tell them, they asked for photo verification. That showed me they take security into account! We switched rooms (to matching rooms, no upgrade). Mace and Lysol in both hands, I found the room to be pleasant. Yes, there was a slight musty scent, but once we turned on the A/C, the musty smell disappeared. The room was spacious with a sofa (possibly a bed, but never used it), two double beds and a television refrigerator and microwave. I was quite content (I have a sensitive nose, so I smelled everything and nothing smelled bad.) Most of our day was spent in Disney, but the hotel was spacious enough that when we did retire from Disney, or take a break. There is ample lighting in the parking lot, plenty of shops around. Maybe it is because we don't make our hotel a home is because we enjoyed this. The carpet was a bit frayed, but we never walk around barefoot in the hotel (regardless of any hotel). The only thing I would change is the smell of the Lobby and the Breakfast Room. It really stunk! The Breakfast Room was just another room converted so it was small and stunk! Due to its price in consideration to the proximity to I-4 and Disney, restaurants and shops, I recommend this place. Remember, it is not the Doubletree, so don't expect luxury, but do expect a decent place to rest/sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Famof4fromNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night since we arrived in Kissimmee earlier than expected for our Disney trip. This budget hotel was not fancy, but it was clean and the staff was very kind. The free breakfast was lacking, but it was free and took the edge off while we looked for something else. Expect all carbs. Plus, the free wifi worked perfectly. (Unlike the expensive Disney reports which make you pay $10/day for internet access!)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, pleasant, safe, reasonable rate; everything I wanted and needed.”
Reviews.Author: Adelheide
Reviews.Content: Though I knew ahead of time I was going to be in the area last Saturday, February 13th, I unexpectedly had no place to stay. It was a very busy time and driving away from the area I had been visiting, looking for a place to stay for the night, there were a lot of "No Vacancy" and "Sold Out" signs. Because the place looked nice, was conveniently located and I knew and trusted the name though I had never stayed at one before, I stopped at the Travelodge and waited in line at the registration desk. Hearing the conversation with those in line ahead of me, I could tell there were still rooms available and that I did not need to leave and search further. Sophie was the clerk on duty and while I was waiting, I watched how she took care of those ahead of me, answering the phone and tending to everything else at the same time, never losing her serene, pleasant, efficient and professional manner, even when a couple ahead of me required some patience on Sophie's part though it was given without it being obvious that it was being given. When it was my turn, everything was perfect; Sophie gave me the type of room I needed: first floor, no smoking, two beds (one for me and one for my bags/things), and although there was not a room available on the parking lot side, she gave me one near the walkway from the parking lot. Sophie assured me (just as I was getting ready to inquire) as to the security of the facility. I was very impressed. My husband has been in management for many, many years and wherever I am I see things from the management point of view as well as from a customer's point of view. When I reached my room, I was very pleased. It was beautiful and spacious. I LOVED the shower! I hope you know and appreciate what an asset your company has in Sophie. She, after all, is the human face and voice your visitors see and hear. She is the one who creates an opinion of your facility and perhaps the chain, in the mind of your visitors. Sophie is definitely a valuable asset. Sincerely, Adele Potter

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: BarbieZ28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while on vacation in FL. The hotel is not a fancy place, but merely a place to rest your head at night. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, this is not for you. If you are looking for someplace to sleep and a hot shower then this is it. Overall it's an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “easy access and affordable”
Reviews.Author: donjuanMichigan
Reviews.Content: i stayed here because it looked casual and i got more than expected. restaurants near and just a little ways from old town entertainment. staff was good and got my room without any delay. will not comment on pool as i did not use it. the room was even larger than i thought. good size bathroom. will stay here again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Run, far far away and then run a bit more!”
Reviews.Author: pinkygeekydo
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel later in the evening and was given a room in the very back of the hotel. Upon arrival at my room I noticed there were people conducting "business" across the parking lot in a field. As a single woman traveling alone it made me a bit nervous so I quickly made my way to the room. The room was horrible, dirty and dark. There was a strong smell of mold/mildew and stale smoke. The bed was hard/ uncomfortable and sounded like there was a plastic coating on it. The carpet was ripped, furniture banged up and broken. There were many many spots on the wall where you could tell holes have been patched up, except for one - it looked like they just stuck an artificial plant in there instead. The bathroom sliding door would not close at all. There is a helicopter tour company located near by as well, it was very noisy! I was able to get online with the provided WiFi, which came in very handy. While checking my email there was a noise outside, someone tried forcefully to open my door, then they pounded on the door, a pizza menu was later shoved through the large gap between the door and the frame. This happened a second time a few minutes later. I no longer felt safe staying there. I called my husband in tears telling him I needed to find another place to stay. I was able to book another hotel online and quickly packed up to leave. I stopped by the front desk on my way to the new hotel to check out but there was no one there. I have emailed and called in regards to this multiple times and never heard back from them. I finally contacted the company I booked the hotel through and was offered a refund for one night of my would have been three night stay. Yet again, the Travelodge fails to provide quality service and customer care.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Potential!!!! Review for two stays”
Reviews.Author: Lois P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Travelodge twice now. The first time (June 2006) we got smoking double queen pool view rooms. The rooms are very large which is great since we have 8 people in our family traveling. The rooms were clean, the pool area was well kept, and the kids loved the play area/game room!! Since our trip was for a week that time we enjoyed the use of the onsite laundry. The breakfast was kind of the joke of the trip (but not a deal breaker). The location was awesome!!! The whole family was impressed at the hotel for the price we paid! The only bad thing I can say about my first stay was that the carpet really needed replaced. So when we decided to go back to Disney World and Dayton Beach last summer (July 2008) we knew we wanted to stay here again. When I booked the rooms I was told the breakfast was updated since we stayed last and the hotel was painted, OK Great!!! So I book two double queen smoking rooms again. Once checked in I was keeping out the room ( I'm actually in the hotel industry so I love seeing hotel rooms) I noticed the carpet still needed replace really badly .. to the point that the tacks were exposed. Then I noticed no ashtrays in the rooms I stopped my mm from lighting up because I realized we were in a mom-smoking room. One I know it is a current trend to charge a huge fee for smoking in a mom-smoking room. Two I think of the other hotel guests that we be coming in after us expecting a non-smoking room to not be smoked in. I walked down to the front desk and let them know the situation very politely. I know these things happen. They "upgraded" us to two smoking double queens with Kitchenettes. It wasn't pool view but I'm excited we could really use the kitchenettes. I thanked the front desk person and went on my merry way. Once we got to our rooms it felt like we were banished to the dungeon. The rooms just felt dirty and gritty. The carpet was worse then the other rooms, the mattresses need to be replaced, the internet signal was very low if we had a signal at all (they did seem to have a network set up with multipliable routers), The Kitchenette was great other than the toaster and larger coffee pot (there was a smaller coffee pot in the room that worked fine) was broken, the pool area was still very well kept (but there were non-guests that looked kind of scary lurking around the pool/play area), and we got charged for making a local call to a pizza place. The location is still great, (just a short drive to Disney World) The flea market next door was great also. Lots of shopping with in walking distance. This hotel has so much potential. With some heavy cleaning, the replacement of things like the mattresses and the carpet (not to mention the replacement or removal of broken appliances ) during the slow season, maybe another router to boost the signal to cover the rooms we were in also,and a security guard this hotel could truly be great! Oh we never did get around to the breakfast due to us having the kitchenette. Oh and the charge for the local calls... please at least inform your guest local calls cost (we have cell phones this would not have been a deal breaker for us either) at best maybe see about a phone company that doesn't charge for local calls. This property makes me wish I had the money or backing to buy this hotel and really turn it around. All in all we had great time.

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY - As fast as you can!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sig25
Reviews.Content: This was my worst experience EVER!!!! Upon entering the room, heavy musty smell. There were a few cracked tiles around the jacuzzi tub with exposed sharp edges and some kind of mold growing in it. There was quite a bit of mold in the bathroom. I also found a broken electrical outlet cover. I took photos and video and will be sharing them with Florida Department of Business and Professional Regulation, Division of Hotels and Restaurants. http://www.myflorida.com/dbpr/hr/index.html I am going this far because the hotel refused to refund our money as we booked through Priceline. This was a lesson well learned. Manager has consistently avoided numerous phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Carpet made my kids feet turn black - filthy and tired”
Reviews.Author: guzzlers
Reviews.Content: stayed for our first & second night - it was basic and skanky. the pool was ok and it had a laundry. But you had to wear shoes or your feet got filthy from the manky old carpets. It was handy being on route 192 and all the shops nearby but we checked out and into a disney area hotel called the regal sun for a similar price which was far cleaner. free breakfast was basic. there is a massive orange shop next door which sells discount disney and seaworld tickets. seaworld is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Venbead
Reviews.Content: There are not adequate words to describe what I encountered in the bathroom upon my arrival. I checked in very late after a long flight. It was about 11:30pm. The front desk staff was cordial. He seemed tired and was not particularly friendly. One doesn't expect deluxe accomodations from a 2 star hotel so I was unfazed by this. It was a very affordable 2 night stay close to where I needed to be. However there are some basic necessities one requires in an overnight stay and a toilet that wouldn't be declared a biohazard is one of them. Not only had my toilet not been cleaned (yet there were fresh linens on the rack?) but to my horror the seat was smeared with human excrement. I called the front desk immediately and let the phone ring for 5 minutes with no answer. I attempted to clean the mess with an entire box of tissue, called the front desk again 10 minutes later, no answer. I finally gave up and went to bed wondering the whole time if I was sleeping on dirty sheets even thought the beds were made. I complained the next morning and the clerk at the desk said he would make sure the manager from the cleaning dept was made aware and the bathroom would get an extra cleaning. It seemed clean when i returned. Upon checkout at 5:30 am I was told by the very unfriendly clerk that their computers were turning over for the night and it would be at least 10 minutes before I could check out. I was not happy about this as i had planned just enought time to get my rental car back and get to the airport on time. Why would the hotel wait until 5:30 am to turn the computers over? why not at 2am or 3am. there were two other people who came in to check out after me that were just as upset that they had to wait. all and all there has to be a cleaner better run hotel on the same road for the same money. I certainly would have paid more if i had known how awful it could be

Reviews.Title: “Basic and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Datchet
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap first nights accommodation for the evening we flew in from the UK and that is exactly what we got. Place looks as if it needs a thorough clean and re furbishment. Pictures on the web site are a little mis leading. Room was basic and tatty but clean, was OK as we were so tired after travelling and just wanted somewhere to crash out. We had considered staying there for a week on our return to the disney area and thankfully had not booked as we would have been very disappointed. Not situated in the nicest location but close to interstae etc. for next days travelling. Staff were very friendly but we would not stay there again. For a few dollars more there is better to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Good Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: Nepean03
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay this year and our 6th stay in total at the Travelodge Suites. The property has been repainted and is no longer pink and looks great. They have put new carpets, beds etc in some of the rooms. Since we request a smoking room I suspect that these are the last rooms to be renovated. Our room was clean and quiet. The hotel was not full at any time but his made for a nice quiet vacation. Once again Mike and Patricia (Front Desk) and Robin, (Manager made us feel welcome and were most helpful. Kissimmee in general was really quiet. The restaurants were never busy and Disney was quieter than we were used to. We hope to be back in late January and will probably stay at the Travelodge again. The free breakfast of cereals, juice, toast, english muffins and muffins is good, free wi-fi is necessary for us as well as a large safe. The price is right and we feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it is cheap.....”
Reviews.Author: AmesFL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple nights last week with friends from Europe. The room was basically clean but the place is really run down. One of us slept on the sofa bed mattress- set upon the floor- as the bed was not fit to sleep upon. The regular bed matteresses were old. We burned candles to manage the musty smell. The pool was well kept but again, really old. Property was quiet and seemed mostly to have young families travelling with small kids. Breakfast was just OK, no fresh fruit. One of the more annoying things was that the room safe was defective and would not lock closed. There was a coffee maker in the room ( a plus).

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of a tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: sealunker
Reviews.Content: Nicely priced hotel especially since the area is such a tourist trap. The room was clean although the bathroom smelled like someone missed the mark a few times. The service was ok, but nothing extraordinary. The sad thing is we preferred hanging out at the hotel than our visit to Animal Kingdom. The best offering of the hotel is the location. It's in walking distance of numerous franchise restaurants like Denny's or Macaroni Grill. The hotel will also offer coupons to certain restaurants which actually turned out pretty good. On a side note: if you are going to take advantage of the free shuttle to the theme parks, make sure you find out the departure times the night before or you will most likely miss them. We missed them and ended up using a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “dingy and run-down”
Reviews.Author: mwood1978
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned an 11 day trip to Florida earlier this year. We do not have a great deal of extra money, so we needed to make the most of the money that we had budgeted for our trip. I did hours and hours of research via the internet checking out hotel review after hotel review trying to find a hotel that was clean, with a few amenities, and for a budget price. Of all of the hotels I read reviews on, this hotel seemed to be a good option at a great price. We only ended up staying 2 nights. These are the things that occured during our short stay. First, we paid extra money for a room with a pool view. Our view was of the laundromat/game room. The door was warped, and did not close properly, which is what allowed the little lizards into our room! Granted, they are not dangerous, but it is creepy to have little wiggly things running around on the floor. We have a 6 month old, 7 year old and 10 year old, so we have to get up in the night sometimes. Stepping on lizards, or having to put on shoes when you get out of bed is just not acceptable to me, no matter how inexpensive a hotel is. The pool scene was just plain gross. There was an orange peel and trash lying around, and the worst thing was that there were about 30 people(mostly teens) in the pool roughhousing, and one of them was bleeding from the mouth into the pool, not getting out! I realize that this is not the management's fault, but it was gross just the same. After leaving the pool, we saw a bunch of barbequed chicken bones lying on the ground! I thought, what a great way to attract bugs! When I took my children to the complimentary "breakfast", it consisted of a room about 15 feet by 15 feet that had literally 50-60 people in it all shoving past each other to get their food. The entire room was filled with smoke from the toaster. We went to the Waffle House next door. I went to talk to someone about our room conditions, and was told that there were no rooms available that we could switch to, and that the heat had warped the door, and that it was not a big deal. The next day, after I almost stepped on a lizard in the room I went to talk to the manager. She offered me another room, but did tell me that in Florida, those lizards get in everywhere. I find that hard to believe. The air-conditioner smelled musty, and we all woke up feeling like we had colds, complete with headaches. The manager also offered to take 10% off of the price of our room if we stayed! We did not want to stay. The hotel was really kind of gross. We didn't see any cockroaches, but there were little flies or gnats in our room. We ended up going to a different hotel for only 20 dollars more a night, and it was clean and a really nice hotel. I think some people embellish stories in reviews, and also expect too much from budget hotels sometimes. However, I am not one of those people. Travelodge did not do anything to me, and I am not out to get them. I just don't think that it is a relaxing place to stay, especially if you have children. I also think that it should be a lot cleaner. There should not be bones and fruit peelings left around the premises for people to step on. Also, if someone does go to the person at the desk with a valid complaint, such as not getting what you pay for, having lizards in the room, or a door that does not close properly, they should not be brushed off. That is not a good way to run a business where all revenue depends on satisfied consumers. If Travelodge needs to raise the price of their rooms a little bit to hire a groundskeeper, exterminator, get new air conditioners, buy some trash cans, or build a bigger breakfast room, it would be well worth it, because as it is now, I would be surprised if many people would return to this establishment a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place at all...”
Reviews.Author: Jay15oc
Reviews.Content: This is a fine place to stay if you are looking for a non-fancy reasonably priced place to stay while doing Orlando touristy stuff. The rooms are pretty clean and large. The pool was really warm for winter, although it did have a lot of leaves in it. The staff was friendly and helpful. You can walk to Waffle House, and it's right across the street from Chili's, UNOs, and very closeby are giftshops and other restaurants. Less than 10 minutes from Disney stuff. Not a bad place at all. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: maryarmit
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a school group trip to Disney World and could not have been more pleased with our stay at this Travelodge. It was located in a good area, only 15 minutes from the parks. The free shuttles ran on time and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us. Everyone was so nice and the housekeeping staff did a great job. Yes, the bathroom ceilings could be redone, but the tub and encloser itself were new and the showerhead wonderful. You just can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay ONLY!”
Reviews.Author: wishinonastar
Reviews.Content: We had planned a last minute trip to Disney during the Christmas break and were booked in a Disney hotel at premium $$. We knew we would be arriving late and decided to stay at the Travelodge for that night because the price for a room that slept 5 was quite cheap! You can't miss this motel, because of its proximity to a very Large Orange (souveneir shop). My first impression came from the clerk checking us in. It was late in the evening and I'm sure she was tired, but she was curt, not in a rude way, but certainly not friendly or welcoming. She did eventually make eye contact with me when she handed me my room key and wished me a pleasant evening - unfortunately no smile. We pulled into a parking spot, which I thought was going to be the last time we would see our car, because I was sure that it would be stolen by the morning - the area doesn't instill a sense of security. We tried to turn the light on when we got into the room, but the bulb must have been blown, we finally were able to get some lights on. First impression was that the room was a nice size, with 2 double beds, and a full size pull out couch, the bathroom was small and adequate. There was quite a bit of mold on the bathroom ceiling and the carpet was worn and our socks were darker on the bottom after walking around on it. There was a lingering odor, sort of smoky, but we decided that it was probably other guests smoking outside and the odor was wafting in under the door. You could easily hear what was going on outside the door, which was probably due to a poor seal between the door and the frame. Our car was there in the morning, the beds were so-so and my back only hurt a little. We were in a hurry to get to the parks, so we skipped the continental breakfast and checked out. Our clerk who checked us out was friendly and asked how things were. When I told him about the light and the mold - he thanked me, made a note of it and said he would have it taken care of. All in all for the price I paid, I felt I got my money's worth. I knew what to expect after reading other reviews on TripAdvisor. My advice for anyone planning to stay here, only stay for a night or two. This was a good transition motel, but I couldn't see staying here and feeling comfortable, and at ease for an entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place...cheap and good”
Reviews.Author: roshanis
Reviews.Content: Pros Good and cheap place to stay in Orlando. Nice people, good service and rooms are nice. Near to every thing in Orlando. Cons They charge about $1 per day for service charge....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: REGRUL
Reviews.Content: We first checked in, front desk staff was friendly, however the area is a bit rundown however since going through Priceline we couldn't change our minds. We got to our room and we could smell the mold, ect. There was a hole in the wall, door lock broke, visible black mold in the bathroom, remote for the tv was broke, carpet looked like it was never cleaned. Blankets on the bed were old and worn. The entire hotel is very run down and I would never recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamLisa
Reviews.Content: June 2006 was my second stay in the Travelodge Suites East Gate Orange. The first time we had a lovely suite for 4 people, the second time we had two family rooms connected by a small kitchen. Both stays were perfectly enjoyable - good pool, check in desk, rooms etc. I love the huge Orange shaped gift shop which is on site and packed full of great souvenirs, gifts, etc. First time I stayed here was 2001 - by 2006 the rooms seemed a little shabbier, in need of a spruce up but mainly okay. Used the shuttle bus to Disney with no problems - reliable and safe. Flea market just around the corner and close to all the parks, shops etc. Great budget hotel that works for smaller groups but also larger families staying together.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take the shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: ejwendeler
Reviews.Content: Let me start by telling you, that yes, in a way theses are ''suites'', we asked for a stove top and fridge and that is what we received. You are not staying at the Ritz Carlton, but it is good for what you are paying. We paid 62.95$ / night with AAA. The room had 2 double beds, 1 pull-out couch, a small bathroom across the way to the little kitchen. In the rooms itself we had a fridge and microwave, for a total of 2 fridges, 1 microwave and 1 stove top. The rooms are somewhat clean, not that there are bugs or anything, but you can tell that the tub/shower had soap scum on it. The complimentary breakfast was better then expected. Compared to the other reviews management seems to have ''fixed'' this little problem. It consisted of English muffins, muffins, cereals, coffee, juice, jams, butter, i think there were even bagels. Now let me tell you about the shuttle...well it is free...besides the fact that the driver nearly killed everyone on the bus. His tire ''somehow'' CAME OFF, while he was getting off the highway (he was slowing down at the time), and to put the cherry on the sundae as it is, he made sure we knew "IT WASN'T HIS FAULT", we where stranded for almost an hour and a half before the company sent an other bus to drive us back. To make a long story short, if you have a car, drive yourself, pay the parking ($11), and come and go as you please. In all the room was nice. We enjoyed ourselves, besides you don' t go to Orlando to stay in your room... If you're on a budget this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Budget Accomodations!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mo.328
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on this site, we decided to book our 6 night stay at the Traveldoge Suites East Gate Orange, anyway. I think the reviews were about 50/50 and figured a budget hotel was good enough for the amount of time we would be spending in the room. (Basically, we would be there only to shower, sleep, and to take advantage of the "continental breakfast". Which is what every one said it was, packaged cakes and donuts.) Hence, you absolutely get what you pay for: Budget accomodations for a budget price. We paid $69.95 a night. We booked it on the Traveldoge site. They confirmed and sent a total price, tax included, for almost $100.00 less, as they did not add the appropriate 13% tax. So that was the beginning of a bad experience. The next was room 101, which is the very moldy, floor tiles held in place with duct tape, cracked sink room that I read about in several reviews. The man at the front desk was accomodating and switched us to a room which was less moldy and although some floor tiles were craked, they were where they were supposed to be. I decided to take no chances and went to the local Walmart to buy a bleach cleanser to scrub the sink, toilet and bathtub, as well as the shower walls. Twice I went to the front desk to make a complaint, with no manager present to speak of. However, the people there were helpful. I have to say, though, the beds were ok and we slept well. There were no bugs and the housekeeping was ok. And these rooms are NOT suites, they are a double room (2 double beds) with a microwave and a small refrigerator. You would think that after knowing that several people speak of buying cleaning products to clean the room while on their vacation, that the owners would change a few things around and allow their staff to use bleach on vital surfaces.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to complain when you're paying $5 a night...”
Reviews.Author: Balamuki
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in Florida for the Disney Marathon on January 7, so we needed someplace reasonably priced and not too far away from Disney World. We settled on the Big Orange (seriously, the hotel is behind a HUGE orange) and we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Check-in was great, the people behind the counter were very nice…in fact, I don’t recall coming across even one surly employee the entire time. The housekeeping staff gave us extra anything we asked for; the hotel staff promptly raised the temperature of the hot tub at the request of the achy marathoners, etc. The hotel was ideally located, as there had to have been at least 10 or 15 restaurants and a few overpriced markets and liquor stores within walking distance. The 24-hour CVS was right across the street. The pool was warm, the hot tub was clean, the rooms were neat (which is really the best one can say about motel-type accommodations), my dad loved the couch cause it felt just like his couch at home :-), all the appliances in the room worked well (refrigerator, microwave, television) and once we figured out how the lights in the room worked, everything was gravy. We did have a few instances where we came back to the room at 5:30 to find that it hadn’t been cleaned yet but frankly, given that the room cost something like $1.50 per night, I wasn’t expecting The Four Seasons type service. In fact, I only had two gripes about this place (and one was a MUCH bigger problem than the other) - the 'breakfast' and the mold/mildew problem in the room. Continental breakfast in a hotel generally seems to mean 'whatever we have left over, that's what you get' and this was no exception: weak coffee, pre-packaged Little Debbie type pastry things, Tang-alternative, etc. This wasn't a huge problem, as we just went to the Super Target and bought our own breakfast supplies - problem solved! The mold issue was something else entirely. At first, my family thought that we were having vague allergic reactions to the difference in temperature from cold New York City to unseasonably warm and humid Florida. But, by the third day I realized that we were ALL waking up EVERY morning sneezing, sniffling and hacking with sore, scratchy throats…which would go away once we left the room for the day and return after being in the room for longer than an hour. When we finally went looking for it, we found that there was visible mold in the bathroom (along the sides and top of the shower – not surprising, I guess), on the vanity in the room AND along the air vents. Phantom illness solved. I don’t know if other rooms would have been cleaner but there it was…not a bad place given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: blueglenn1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights early January but did not expect much from a hotel for this price. We were in a first floor non-smoking room with a queen double bed. OK the bed mattress was hard but the room was clean, the bathroom was extremely clean with large mirrors a washbasin which had minute cracks around the plug ! Toilet and bath with a very good powerful shower over. There were always lots of clean towels and the soap and shampoo were replaced as we needed ,we did not have to ask, it was just done. The television had far more channels than i would have expected which was nice after a hard day visiting attractions ! We would have no problem with staying here again, it's a shame the same cant be said about Budget car hire !! We arrived at Orlando airport after a delay of nearly 2 hours at Gatwick. We went to the rental desk and joined the queue, we had asked for a Mustang to treat ourselves as this was our first holiday together in the States.We were told by the desk clerk that they had no Mustangs available, we were gutted, she offered us a 'small' car but had no photos to show us of what these cars looked like, so we opted for her suggestion of an upgrade to a Toyota Camry which was 'brand new' .We duly paid the $90 and then she tried to get us to pay another $80 for 'extra insurance'.When we declined she was not happy and demanded the name of my car insurers in the UK, which i gave her ! Imagine our disappointment to say the least when we went over to their rental car lot and saw TWO Mustangs there ready to rent !! We both decided that after such a tiring trip we did not want to stand in line again and we took the ' brand new' Toyota with 9500 miles on it !! It was a very nice car BUT it was not 'brand new' That is why we rented it !!! My advice is steer clear of Budget they are only interested in your money, i emailed them on my return and they have not had the decency to get back to me. We were so pleased that Travelodge was better than we expected. Go there,but take my advice about car rental. Have a great holiday .

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: EllieP
Reviews.Content: We had several rooms booked the 2nd week of Nov. and it was terrific. The rooms [big enough for 6 + crib] were great, the location [very close to Main Entrance of Disneyworld] was perfect, and the area [you can walk to many, many restaurants, stores,etc.] was wonderful. And the price was certainly right at $39.95. We paid $5 extra to have rooms that opened right onto the pool and that was worth every penny. The included breakfast is just coffee, juices, tea, water, and oodles of sweet rolls, donuts, granola bars, etc. but it was plenty and FREE. The staff was very nice and helpful, too. We had no complaints. We would definitely stay there again, and probably will soon.

Reviews.Title: “Overlook the exterior, check out the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Budget-Minded
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June 06. We read reviews and were upbeat about our hotel selection. The hotel is next to a big giant orange which is a fresh fruit store & a flea market, which cause a lot of raised eyebrows when we pulled up. The exterior is also a bit of a fright - bright pink and has a bit of a cheap, LOW budget look to it. BUT The rooms are just like the photos. Not overly fancy but clean. The pull-out couch had fresh sheets just like the beds. Mini fridge was very cold & microwave was great. The staff was nice. The "breakfast" is just what other reviewers state, prepackaged doughnuts and other pastries, milk, juice & coffee. They are not in the breakfast business for sure! We only had one problem w/ very noisy hotel guests but the hotel security staff was very quick & courteous. We never had another problem during our stay. If you are staying here for a visit to the Disney parks it is a good choice. You shouldn't be in your room much & when you are the rooms are comfortable & restful. A great price & a good value.

Reviews.Title: “A good decision”
Reviews.Author: rainey1
Reviews.Content: I feel like I made a good decision when I chose to stay at this property. After reading every travel book available on DW at my local bookstore, and every review imaginable on-line; after booking, then canceling at several off-property hotels; after thinking and rethinking every hotel and motel in the Disney area, I finally...hesitantly...began the trip to Disney World on May 6, 2006 with reservations booked at Travelodge East Gate Orange. I was a Disney kid...grew up going to Disney at least once a year, usually staying on-property, and always thought it was such a magical place. So naturally I wanted my own children, on their first visit, to have as magical a time as I had. But my family's finances didn't afford the luxury of staying on-property. I guess we could have scraped by and done it, especially at one of the Value resorts, but my husband and I wanted a larger room (two small children in very close quarters for a week is not my husband's idea of a vacation). So, off-property seemed the logical choice. And to make a long story a little shorter, I focued on "suite" type rooms which had at least a micro-fridge combo and a sitting area, that were reasonably inexpensive, and which were still close enough to DW that we could get to the parks easily without too much travel time. And after about six months of research and second-guessing myself I settled on this Travelodge (second-closest Travelodge on 192). When we arrived at this bright, almost garrish, pink hotel that sat next to a flea market with a bright orange roof on it, my stomach almost did a filp. As far as the hotel's style went, I was a little nervous about what I'd find on the inside. But, thanks to my children's amazingly good behavior on the car trip down, we arrived a day BEFORE our reservations and were extremely tired. I had been hoping that we would be able to check in a day early and that the hotel would be able to accommodate us. Now I wasn't so sure, but I kept an open mind and went into the lobby. The lobby itself was small, but its style was a little toned down from the bright outside decor--nothing too posh, but nothing scary either. On waiting to check in, however, another vacationer in front of me was in the process of telling the manager that his family's room was not acceptable, that it didn't "live up" to the photos on the web, and that when his wife booked it, they had been expecting something all-together different. The manager was very polite to the man, took care of him with no hassles, and even thanked him for trying the hotel. I decided to keep my open mind open a little longer and just see how the room turned out before I bolted. When the manager waited on me, he was very pleasant and professional, didn't make any excuses for what I'd just overheard, and even accommodated my extra night without having to move me around during our stay to do it. He also offered local info on restaurant and attractions. I took the keys and proceeded to my room. When I opened the hotel door, I found the room to be EXACTLY as the photos online had pictured it. I'm not sure if all of the rooms were as clean and well-appointed as mine was (there did seem to be some renovations going on in rooms around ours), but there was nothing I could complain about. I'm not sure if the man who I had heard checking out before he checked in had expected a four star hotel on an economy budget, but as far as I was concerned, my room was more than I could expect for the paltry $46 a night I was paying. The room was spotless. There was not even any dust on the lamps! The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but the room made up for this with a Working refrigerator and microwave, a clean sofa with a coffee table, and an extra dining table with two chairs just perfect for feeding my two little ones during an afternoon snack. All in all I was quite pleasantly surprised. When my husband made the discovery that our remote control had no batteries, I thought "uh-oh", but a quick call to the front desk had a new remote there in under fifteen minutes. After that we had no other problems. No bugs, ants or roaches, always enough towels, and I was even able to keep our laundry done in the coin laundry by the pool while my husband and I watched the kids play in the water. And the pool was NEVER crowded. On two nights, we were the only ones at the pool. Safety had been another concern of mine, but I never felt that we were at risk here, even though this hotel only has exterior corridors. Our room was around back (not poolside, but close to a breezeway that gave us quick access to the pool and laundry), and there was never very much noise. The hotel was located very close to some good restaurants like the Macaroni Grill, and Boston Lobster Feast, and it was right across the street from an easy Krispy-Kreme doughnut breakfast. Oh yes, and as far as that garrish pink exterior went, after a long day at the parks, I was able to spot the hotel a lot easier than others around it. Evey evening I just looked for the bright pink and orange! Not to mention the fact that my kids loved staying at the PINK HOTEL! Since we've been back, all I've heard is that they want to go back to that Pink Hotel. When we do make a return trip to DW, they'll probably get their wish! What a wonderful vacation it turned out to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Price, Great Location, What more can be said?”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaKiraHannah
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this location. In the year since we had stayed here last they have added alarm clocks and coffee machines to the rooms. They have also cleaned up the breakfast area and put in a tile floor, much better. The manager, Robin, is excellent. She is prompt, courteous and friendly. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient. The price was perfect for the budget minded tourists. The pool is clean and kept at a wonderful temperature. The hottub is exactly that HOT and that was awesome after a long day at the theme parks. The rooms had two double beds, plus a pull out sofa. The beds (including the sofabed) were very comfortable and the linens were crisp and clean. The carpeting was very obviously new and the outside appeared to have had a fresh coat of paint. The best thing about the free breakfast is that it is free, the bad part is that it is standard budget hotel breakfast juice, coffee, packaged donuts. You are surrounded by restaurants many within walking distant. There is a superWalmart just around the corner (brand new, I might add) and the hotel is directly on the bus route. There is a large flea market next door and you are moments away from the parks. As far as we are concerned this is a great place to stay at a great price with great service. No complaints on our end, none at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: bwilburn542004
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week the end of April, 2005. I had read reviews prior to booking so was a little nervous. The staff were great, efficient and very friendly. Continental breakfast was packaged donuts, on occasion fresh donuts and rolls, juice, coffee. The room was large and beds very comfortable. The pull-out sofa was comfortable for my older children as well. The housekeeping staff went out of their way daily to see that we had all we needed and kept it clean. My only concern was that the temp outside was 88* and the pool was still heated to a very warm 85*. We are planning to go back this April and will stay at this hotel. Close to everything and shuttle drivers are fantastic and humerous!

Reviews.Title: “Has been upgraded since our last stay - great value!”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times over the past 10 years and really like the location. It takes no more than 15 minutes to drive from the hotel to the Disney theme park parking lots. It's great value for money and close to great dining on the 192. This year we were pleased to see that the outside of the hotel has been pained as has the pool area. It's much cleaner and brighter. The room we had on the first floor must have been recently renovated as the tub and shower looked brand new. The carpet certainly was spotless - this is the first time thas this has been evident in our stay here. The continental breakfast is packaged donuts etc but I have stayed elsewhere on the 192 and that's what they all serve for the same rate. I've paid more and got no better value. We will certainly be back because the location is excellent for the theme parks and for access to the toll roads to the beaches and airport. It's clean and as all the rooms are "suites" you get plenty of space. For the cheap rates they sell these rooms, it's value for money for the budget traveller who is out all day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Magsss
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay in this hotel for one week. First of all, the rooms do not look like the rooms on the website. We had a two bedroom suite. However, they failed to state that a two bedroom suite, is actually a one bedroom with an additional two bedrooms in the living area. Also, there was supposed to be 2 televisions, but there was only one in the living room, where the other bedroom was located. The chairs in the "dining room" area were ripped and torn and the cushions and the seating was falling apart. The sofa's were losing their springs, therefore, whenever you sat on the sofa you sunk. Mind you we had to wait over an hour wait for this room to be cleaned. The carpet also had cigarette burns in them. The kitchen area was big and the bathroom did include a jacuzzi bathtub. The worst was the "free" continental breakfast, which included stale doughnuts and fruit punch. The juice machine was broken so the only thing you could drink was fruit punch. I ended up staying for one night only and headed for a different hotel. The last thing I want to mention is that this hotel is located directly on a major highway, therefore, if you do not have a car, you have to walk everywhere or spend a lot of money on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room and price for a brief stay”
Reviews.Author: satanhimself
Reviews.Content: We needed a place for one night before catching a very-early-morning plane at the Orlando airport. And because we just needed a place to sleep for a few hours, we didn't want to pay the $100 rates on Intl. Drive (due to conventions in town) or the $80 rates near the airport. So we checked the coupon books and walked into this property and was offered a rate even lower than the current coupon. While the place was fine for our purposes, and it was supposed to be nonsmoking, it did smell like a smoking room. Also the "suite" is really just a regular room, but with a sofa, handy microwave and refrigerator---which really was handy at 3:30 am when we needed to fix ourselves a mini-breakfast before dashing to the airport. Our only complaint was the fact that even though the desk clerk knew we had to catch a plane, she took about 10 minutes to check in a new guest (who, of course, had no credit card, and complained about the price, etc., etc.) at 3:45am, rather than quickly check us out. The "orange" shaped gift shop in front of the property is the ultimate tourist trap---but was fun to browse. It was great to see many of the same tacky Florida souvenirs that I remember from my youth.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Suites East Gate Orange
HotelInfo.Address: 5399 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway, Kissimmee, FL 34746
